definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The hecklers were conducted away from the hall at the request of the Chairman.
sentences.chinese: 主席要求把搗蛋分子強行趕出大廳。

sentences.english: In the hall, the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大廳裏，浮淺得挑釁者將被容許吞下燕子。

sentences.english: His hall was decorated with deer horns.
sentences.chinese: 他的大廳用鹿角裝飾着。

sentences.english: The hall was built on a high terrace, and has 21 rooms.
sentences.chinese: 大廳既建立在一個高的平臺，並有21間。

sentences.english: The lifts are in the lobby near the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 電梯間在大廳靠大門外。

sentences.english: I entered the lobby, and loved the ambience immediately.
sentences.chinese: 一進到大廳，我馬上愛上了那裏的氣氛。

sentences.english: Mar 2016 Here She Comes, Royal Festival Hall, London (performance in collaboration with Marvin Gaye Chetwynd.
sentences.chinese: 表演，皇家節日大廳，倫敦，英國。

sentences.english: The hall was bedecked with flags and flowers for the wedding ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 爲了這次婚禮，大廳用彩旗和花裝飾起來了。

sentences.english: The press-conference room adjacent to the mixed-zone was just as crazy.
sentences.chinese: 靠近混合區的新聞發佈會大廳同樣狂熱。

sentences.english: The focal point of the construction lies at the W?hringerstrasse, where the main entrance, accessible through an inviting hall, is located.
sentences.chinese: 大樓結構的焦點位於由大廳可到達的主入口所在地。

sentences.english: The noisy fellow was thrown out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 這個吵吵嚷嚷的傢伙被人從大廳裏攆出去了。

sentences.english: This hall may is hired for weddings and other functions.
sentences.chinese: 這個大廳可租來舉行婚禮或其他集會。

sentences.english: Long-stemmed models ankled though the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 身材修長的模特兒嫋嫋婷婷地走過大廳。

sentences.english: The hall was circumfused with a cordial and friendly atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 大廳中充滿了親切友好的氣氛。

sentences.english: Kevin grabbed for his wrist, knocking a sushi roll across the living room.
sentences.chinese: 凱文抓住了他的手腕，一卷壽絲被打的飛出了大廳。

definition: drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
